ranked_diseases.explanation: Noonan Syndrome often presents with facial dysmorphism and may include clinodactyly. Noonan Syndrome 1 is a common subtype.
Similar to Noonan Syndrome 1, this subtype also exhibits facial abnormalities and limb anomalies like clinodactyly.
Kabuki Syndrome is associated with distinctive facial features and may include clinodactyly.
This subtype of Kabuki Syndrome also presents with facial anomalies and limb deformities, including clinodactyly.
Robinow Syndrome can cause abnormal facial structure and digital anomalies like clinodactyly.
